subject: Re: [JUnit][New to JUnit]
msgSnippet: After doing that, if you re into having something to reference on your desk, might not be a bad idea to pick up a copy of JUnit Recipes :-) Have fun getting
messageBody:
After doing that, if you're into having something to reference on your desk,
might not be a bad idea to pick up a copy of "JUnit Recipes" :-)

Have fun getting [test] infected Aditya,
--MB

On 5/11/07, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains762@...> wrote:
>
> Aditya Sinha wrote:
>
> > I am into manual testing.I am new to JUnit.Kindly guide me that what
> > kind of knowledge is reqd before starting it.
>
> I suggest you use keywords like JUnit and guide in Google. Good luck.
> --
> J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca
> Your guide to software craftsmanship
> JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
> 2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
>
>
